Name: Malcolm Lowry
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Review: The Daiquiri meets the Margarita in this suitably 'funky' and punchy cocktail.
History: Created by drinks author David Broom. Named after Malcolm Lowry's 1947 novel Under the Volcano which explores a man's battle with alcoholism in Mexico.
Nutrition: One serving of Malcolm Lowry contains 143 calories
